description: A creature, having the appearance and gait of a gangly, bowed dog or canid.  The animal looks sickly, with the gray skin looking smooth, being almost completely hairless except for patches of skin over the shoulders in some individuals.  The fangs look bigger than they should, and while the overall appearance of the beast is fragile, the illusion is quickly broken once you see it moving to hunt prey.
//: These are what show up when you google 'chupacabra mange'. Former dogs/dog-sized canids, now at the boundary of being diseased animals and newborn youkai
//2: Physical armor values should be removed IF the not yet implemented YOUKAI flag gives passive resistances.

description: A small creature, having the appearance and gait of a gangly, hairless cat or dog.  The head is big relative to the rest of the body, with big black, almond shaped eyes.  The limbs end up at long fingers and toes, each having an equally long, sharp claw.  Perhaps the most noticeable part of the animal are however, the "quills" running down from the top of the head its lower back.
//2: These are the actual chupacabra cryptids, if a very small version

description: A cunning pack predator, once extinct in the northern island from the Japanese archipielago. Once revered yet feared in ancient Japan, the animal suffered a directed campaign of extermination during the 19th and early 20th centuries.  Similar in size to a North American wolf, both were considered to be close cousins before the Cataclysm, if not the same species only separated by geography.
//: Generic Ezou wolf. Basically a North American wolf that got stuck in Hokkaido, however these seemed to ignore humans except under arduous circumstances. Probably only the youkai version should spawn as they're a higher risk for the player

description: A HUGE black wolf, around the size of a cow, with a tail much longer than it should be, and bright red eyes full of hatred against humanity.
//: Should have enough health regen to overcome the bleeding, giving the appearance this thing just won't die
//2: Special attacks are a short 2-3 tiles leap downing the player, bite to the neck
//3: Should be weaker-than-normal to stab and bullet damage. Should be weaker-than-normal against soul damage. Also anything with silver should do x2-x4 damage (randomized)

description: A dog-looking… beast, this animal looks like a mix between a big cat, a bear, a dinosaur and other animals you can't think at the moment.  The gait is unlike anything you have seen before, both awkward yet agile. The tail is thick and short, the limbs somewhat resemble those of a human, but shorter in relation to the body, with the hind limbs being shorter than the front limbs, each of them ends on a feet with short claws, capable of rudimentary grappling.  The most shocking part of the animal is the very robust, huge trapezoidal head, with equally huge fangs showing well past the reptilian lips.  Looking at it forces a primal bubble of fear from the depths of your mind come to the surface, ready to cavitate.
//: Generic Gorgonopsid, this template is for animals that look like Inostrancevia + Pristerognathus. The later is technically a Therocephalian but they look similar enough and until there are enough of them there's no need for a different identification. This should NOT spawn, mon_gorgonopsid_inostrancevia is the 'active' version
//2: The harvest of these should be more mammal than reptilian, however currently both have the same values

description: A dog-looking… beast, this animal looks like a mix between a big cat, a bear, a dinosaur and other animals you can't even think of.  The gait is unlike anything you have seen before, both awkward yet agile. The tail is thick and short, the limbs somewhat resemble those of a human, but shorter in relation to the body, with the hind limbs being shorter than the front limbs, each of them ends on feet with short claws, capable of rudimentary grappling.  The most shocking part of the animal is the very robust, huge trapezoidal head, with equally huge fangs showing well past the lips.  Looking at it forces a primal bubble of fear from the depths of your mind come to the surface, ready to cavitate.

A dog-looking… beast, this animal looks like a mix between man's best friend, a dinosaur and other animals you can't even think of.  The gait is unlike anything you have seen before, both awkward yet agile, with the animal running on a similar way you'd imagine a crocodile can. The tail is thick and short, the weirdly human-looking limbs sprawl at the sides, each of them ends on feet with short claws.  The most shocking part of the animal is the very robust, huge, flat trapezoidal head, with equally huge fangs showing well past the lips.  You think, you know deep inside you a bite will really hurt.
//: Dog-sized but sprawls instead of having an erect posture, with different body part ratios too

description: A cunning pack predator, once extinct in the three southern islands from the Japanese archipielago. Once revered in ancient Japan, the animal suffered the consequences of human activities in modern times, not to mention the active persecution during the 19th and early 20th centuries.  Smaller than a North American wolf, it's still a wolf regardless.
//: Generic non-Ezou wolf. Probably only the youkai version should spawn as they're a higher risk for the player

description: Also known as Tasmanian wolf, or Coorinna, among several other aboriginal names.  Not actually a member of the Canidae family, but a marsupial like roos and opossums, this gray, long and short dog-looking animal has a bunch of characteristic black stripes on the back.  Considered to be the apex predator of some Oceanic regions, not much is known about the behavior of this nocturnal animal.
//: Previously extinct in the Outside world, they were passively transferred to Gensokyo at some point in the past.
//2: These technically should have zombie versions, but I don't like that idea

description: An tiny, cute and defenseless Thylacine puppy.

name: Vengeful Spirit
description: A nearby vengeful spirit, summoned by Kaenbyou to help her.
//: Onryou should be difficult to hit, have a *very* weak armor-ignoring attack, should swarm the target, and reduce its morale 2-3 per hit. They're basically trash mobs that keep enemies ocuppied.
NOTE: they should be interactable NPCs, NOT monsters
name: moon rabbit
moon rabbit
description: A member of the Lunar Defense Corps, carrying a Lunar rifle.  Were it not for the rabbit ears, you would have mistaken her for a human.  She looks confident and highly capable for combat.  Were the Gyokuto this well trained before?
